name: Barbour, Haley
title: Founding Partner
political_donations: Longtime Republican fundraiser and party operative; served as RNC Chairman 1993-1997; chaired Republican Governors Association 2009-2010 raising record $117M; major contributor to Republican candidates and committees
notes: 63rd Governor of Mississippi 2004-2012; Chairman of the Republican National Committee 1993-1997; co-founded BGR Group (then Barbour Griffith & Rogers) in 1991; one of Washington's top lobbyists; was Republican nominee for U.S. Senate in 1982

name: Beim, Robert B.
title: Managing Director
ngos: UC Berkeley Foundation Board of Trustees (Chair, Investment Committee)
notes: Founded real estate investment firm Beim & James in 1975; joined Woodside Asset Management in 1989; CPA licensed in California; MBA from Stanford GSB; BA in Biological Sciences from UC Berkeley

name: Bowlsby, Robert Addison II
notes: Retired 2022 after 45-year career in intercollegiate athletics; Commissioner of the Big 12 Conference 2012-2022; previously Athletic Director at Stanford University, University of Iowa, and University of Northern Iowa; appointed to U.S. Olympic Committee Board of Directors 2007; played key role in creation of College Football Playoff

name: Brill, John Marty Jr.
notes: Resident of Palo Alto, California; associated with Brill Lands, Inc.

name: Deeter, Byron
title: Partner
ngos: National Venture Capital Association (NVCA Board Chair 2024-2025); U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Foundation; Pledge 1%; Cal Rugby
notes: Partner at BVP since April 2005; previously founder and CEO of Trigo Technologies (sold to IBM); co-authored Bessemer's 10 Laws of Cloud Computing and the Forbes Cloud 100; 26 portfolio companies valued above $1 billion including 13 IPOs

name: Downer, E. Michael
title: Vice Chairman of the Board
ngos: National Association of Corporate Directors; Napa Sunrise Rotary Club
notes: Great-grandson of E.M. Downer who founded Mechanics Bank in 1905; family is in fourth generation of bank leadership; has lived in Napa since 1989; attended Linfield College and Pacific Coast Banking School; founded Downer & Associates, Inc.

name: Fulstone, Steven A.
title: Rancher / Owner
notes: Sixth-generation rancher in Smith Valley, Nevada; Fulstone family has ranched in Nevada since 1856; operates hay production, cattle ranching, and custom farming; 2022 regional winner of the Environmental Stewardship Award for conservation practices

name: Goodin, Robert Allan
title: Partner
ngos: American Law Institute (member 1990); American Bar Foundation (Fellow 1990); American College of Trial Lawyers (Fellow 1995); Ninth Circuit Judicial Conference Executive Committee (1991-1994)
notes: Born February 5, 1947 in Berkeley, CA; BA from Harvard University 1968; JD from UC Berkeley Boalt Hall 1974; law clerk to Judge Charles B. Renfrew, N.D. California 1974-1975; U.S. Navy Lieutenant 1969-1971; Martindale-Hubbell AV Preeminent rating

name: Gsell, Gordon B. Jr.
notes: Formerly registered securities broker (Legg Mason); based in Houston, Texas; director of the Gsell Family Foundation, a Houston-based philanthropic organization focused on health-related funding

name: Hackbarth, Alfred E. III
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Over 25 years in real estate industry; previously VP at SRS Real Estate Partners (Phoenix), Director of Capital Markets at Cushman & Wakefield, and Senior Associate at Marcus & Millichap; specializes in multifamily investments in Western U.S. markets

name: Imrie, Kent S.
employer: MIV Insurance Services LLC (Malloy, Imrie & Vasconi)
title: Partner / Owner
notes: Great-grandson of A.H. Smith, one of the founding families of MIV Insurance Services in Napa, CA; firm has been operating since 1900 (currently 125+ years); former Napa Chamber of Commerce Citizen of the Year; involved with local schools and Boys & Girls Clubs

name: Irwin, John N. III
title: Managing Director
political_donations: Major Republican donor; approximately $358,000 total contributions; $129,500 to Republican National Committee (1992-2008); $89,500 to National Republican Senatorial Committee; $73,600 to John McCain; also contributed to George W. Bush, Mitt Romney, and other Republican candidates
ngos: Achelis & Bodman Foundations (Chairman); Fresh Air Fund (Trustee); Wildlife Conservation Society (Trustee); Sacred Heart School CT (Board of Trustees Chairman); Teachers College Columbia University (Vice Chair of Trustees); Princeton Institute for International and Regional Studies (Advisory Council)
notes: Managing Director of Hillside Capital since 1979; co-founded The Brookside Group in 1977, pioneer in leveraged buyouts; maternal grandfather was Thomas J. Watson Jr., founder of IBM; father John N. Irwin II was U.S. Ambassador to France 1973-1974; BA Princeton; attended L'Institut d'Etude Politique Paris; owns 215,000 acres in Arizona and California (per 1997 Worth Magazine)

name: Kingsley, Daniel R.
title: Chairman
ngos: Schwab Charitable (Board Member); Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy (Board of Trustees); Battery Powered (Board Member); Greenbelt Alliance (Board Member); Committee on Jobs (Board Member)
notes: Co-founded SKS Partners, a San Francisco real estate development firm; previously VP at Maguire Thomas Partners (one of the nation's five largest investment builders in the 1980s); MBA from Wharton School; BS from University of Oregon; MRP from University of Pennsylvania

name: Leach, Howard A. (Alec)
title: Business Development Representative
notes: Also known as Alec Leach; resides in Carmel By The Sea, California; degree in applied agricultural economics from Purdue University; prior positions in agricultural sales and marketing including BASF, PepsiCo, and Taylor Farms; distinct from Ambassador Howard H. Leach

name: Leach, Howard H.
title: President
political_donations: Major Republican donor; $550,200 to Republican National Committee (1992-2015); $452,594 to RNC Republican National State Elections Committee (1991-2000); $357,400 to National Republican Congressional Committee (1992-2018); $100,000 to Restore Our Future PAC (Romney); $100,000 to Bush-Cheney 2001 Inaugural Committee; $25,000 to Republican Governors Association
ngos: Digital Diagnostics (Board Director); American Friends of Versailles (Board); American University of Paris (Board); French-American Foundation (Board); French Heritage Society (Board); Haas Business School UC Berkeley (Board); Hoover Institution Stanford (Overseer); American Enterprise Institute (Board); National Legal Research Center for the Public Interest; Pacific Research Institute
notes: Born June 19, 1930, Salinas, California; BS from Yale University 1952; U.S. Air Force officer 1953-1955; co-founded food-processing corporations 1958-1971; U.S. Ambassador to France 2001-2005; Member and Chairman of UC Board of Regents 1990-2001 (Chairman 1993-1995); Finance Chairman of Republican National Committee 1995-1997; also president of Foley Timber & Land Company and Leach McMicking & Company; resides in Palm Beach, Florida

name: Lowrey, Charles F. Jr.
title: Executive Chairman
ngos: LeapFrog Investments (Leadership Council); BNY Mellon Corporation (Board Director); Geneva Association (Board)
notes: CEO of Prudential Financial December 2018 to March 2025; Chairman from April 2019; became Executive Chairman March 2025; began career as architect, then joined J.P. Morgan in real estate investment banking; joined Prudential 2001; CEO of PGIM (investment management) 2008-2011; BA in architecture from Princeton; MBA from Harvard; MA in architecture from Yale; received H.I. Feldman Prize at Yale 1982

name: McEfee, Camden S.
title: Managing Partner
notes: Joined California Strategies in 1999; previously served as Chief Deputy Cabinet Secretary to Governor Pete Wilson of California; advisor to Arnold Schwarzenegger's Proposition 49 (After School Education & Safety Act of 2002); resides in San Francisco Bay Area

name: McMicking, Henry C.
notes: Note: Henry A. McMicking (1918-2008), pioneer venture capitalist in California, co-founded one of California's first venture capital firms with brother Joseph McMicking; was vice chairman of board at Ampex Corporation; served as mayor of Atherton; Stanford graduate; WWII U.S. Army Air Force intelligence officer (Captain), briefing officer for Normandy invasion. Deceased 2008. Henry C. McMicking may be a different individual.

name: Muller, Brian David
title: Partner
ngos: BOMA San Francisco; Urban Land Institute
notes: Joined Harrigan Weidenmuller in 1993; UC Berkeley Haas School of Business graduate; previously worked at Tandy Computers (Belgium) and British Petroleum (Australia); prior to Harrigan, worked at Damner, Pike and Company / Colliers International in San Francisco; focuses on asset management and tenant improvement projects

name: Muller, Timothy Matthew
title: President
notes: Has worked with Harrigan Weidenmuller Co. for over forty years; serves as president of the firm; San Francisco's oldest commercial real estate company (established 1900), managing over 2 million square feet of property

name: Schadlich, Scott F.
title: President
notes: Founded Next Investments in 2010; over 25 years in real estate and business management; specializes in acquiring and repositioning undervalued commercial real estate; based in Healdsburg, California

name: Schultz, Gregory W.
title: Managing Director, Strategic Clients
ngos: USC Lusk Center for Real Estate (Board Member)
notes: 30 years of experience in title insurance in Southern California with national and international transactions; previously SVP at The Staubach Company Los Angeles; 12 years at Metropolitan Structures West Inc. as SVP; USC alumnus

name: Streblow, Jeff
title: Senior Vice President / Chief Transformation Officer
ngos: Queen of the Valley Foundation (Board Member)
notes: Has worked at Connell Bros. (division of Wilbur-Ellis) since 1983; responsible for $800 million in sales of specialty chemical and ingredients distribution throughout Asia Pacific across 17 countries with 1,200+ employees; worked extensively in Asia; Napa native with family ties to Queen of the Valley

name: Swanson, W. Clarke
title: Founder and former CEO
political_donations: Republican donor; $53,409 to Trump 47 Committee (2024); $33,200 to Graham Victory 2020; $29,000 to Romney Victory (2012); $25,000 to Trump Victory (2016); $25,000 to John McCain (2008); also contributed to Democratic causes including $12,500 to DNC (1992-2010); 25 contributions to Rep. Mike Thompson totaling ~$12,000
ngos: Festival Napa Valley (Board, Chairman of Audit Committee); Hoover Institution Stanford (Board of Overseers); UCSF Foundation (Board); Napa Valley Vintners Association (former director); Friends of Lincoln Theater Yountville (founder and director); Oakville Winegrowers Association (former chairman)
notes: Grandson of Swanson Foods founder Carl A. Swanson; father sold Swanson Foods to Campbell's Soup in 1955; BA in history and political science from Stanford; MS in journalism from Columbia; founded Swanson Vineyards in Oakville 1985; previously in banking, radio, cable TV, and community newspapers; was chairman and CEO of Napa National Bancorp until sale to Wells Fargo in 2002; Swanson Vineyards sold to Vintage Wine Estates 2015, then sold again 2024
